DOC.HEAD: Harvard Historian Inaugurates Lecture Series
DOC.TEXT: Harvard historian David Donald, a two-time Pulitzer Prize winner, will inaugurate a lecture series on the presidency, the White House said Friday. Donald will speak about Abraham Lincoln on Jan. 7 in the State Dining Room before an audience of about 100 invited guests. President and Mrs. Bush will be the hosts. A White House announcement said several lectures will be given each year by historians, biographers and distinguished authors on the presidency. Donald, a professor of American history at Harvard University, has written a number of books about Lincoln and the Civil War including ``Lincoln's Herndon,'' ``Divided We Fought,'' ``Inside Lincoln's Cabinet'' and ``Lincoln Reconsidered.'' He has twice received the Pulitzer Prize for biography.
